content.description: Beautiful, left leaning crack that turns vertical  and slightly overhanging halfway up.  The route starts with a bouldery step into the seem between the Matterhorn and the Grade A boulder. Tight hands finishes with a bulge to the top.
content.protection: Medium Pro (.5-2).  Set an anchor with medium pieces in the crack on top.  Walk-off on the east side.
content.location: The route is the obvious west facing crack in-between the Matterhorn, Flathead and Grade A.

content.description: This wall features several excellent slab problems on amazing rock!
content.protection: Crash pad, but sliding down slab isn't fun.
content.location: This is the south facing slab wall 100 feet to the right of the main approach trail just before you enter the jumble of boulders at the beginning of the Carnivores.

content.description:
Start on a huge jug hold and traverse the lip to the left past some strenuous moves.  Grab the good hold (easier for tall people), mantle and finish.  

  A a classic that needs more traffic!
content.protection:
A few pads and a spotter.   

There is a hole between two boulders below the crux that may freak some climbers out.  Stuff it with pads and put a spotter there if you want to feel better.
content.location: South Carnivore Boulders   The obvious boulder to the south of Cactus Make Perfect.     Follow the Loop Trail west then turn right(north) toward the Carnivores.    30°29'52.66"N,  98°49'39.24"W

content.description: Sit start and climb left along the rounded lip of the saucer shaped boulder.
content.protection: pad
content.location: South Carnivore Boulders beneath a nice tree.   30°29'52.53"N,  98°49'38.68"W

climbs.name: Return of the Flying Flatheads Direct

content.description: Start on an enormous jug and work your way up the arete without using the flake. Decent rock quality and gets sunlight pretty much the entire day. The Arete where the North face meets the NorthWest face.
content.protection: crash pads and spotters
content.location: After you get to the Carnivore boulders, continue to the very back away from the loop trail. the last boulder is Flathead boulder, find the Northwest arete that has a super jug at the bottom.

content.description: Slighly overhanging, thin hands, leads to nice hands, fists and into an off-width, then an off-width slab.  Placed a couple butterflies on this one.
content.protection: Medium to Large Protection (#1-#6).  Bolts on top.  Rap-off.
content.location: Crack on the Western face of the Hamburger Boulder.

content.description: Climb the north-facing arête closest to the Flathead Boulder.  Set up using TR with slings.  Difficult balance and power combo problem.  Watch swing into the Flathead boulder.
content.protection: Uses slings and top rope in the crack just like setting up for Top Choice.
content.location: North arête of Matterhorn boulder in the Top Choice alcove of the Carnivore boulders

content.description: Climbs the arête behind Top Choice.  Can do both sides. Both are fun nice lie-back problems.  Can also climb the face if you like on both sides.
content.protection: Anchors in the crack above Top Choice.  You can put a sling in features above or just use the anchors.
content.location: The arête to the North of Top Choice. On the Matterhorn boulder in the Carnivore boulders.

content.description: This route is the obvious Off-Width to the right of High Octane. Starts in a shallow Chimney that tapers into hand crack. Can chimney, stem, and jam your way up the route.
content.protection: Medium down low to large pieces up high.   Can set up TR with small pieces (#.5, #.4, #.3 and C3s)on the thin crack above High Octane.
content.location: East Face of Grade A Boulder. To the right of High Octane.

content.description: On the opposite side of the Hamburger Boulders from Raw Meat is this tricky off-width. Nice hands to fists then the wide-ness ensues as things get steeper and you pull over a small bulge using butterfly jams. Gear Anchor at the top.  Bring longer slings or cord to extend it and keep your rope from getting chewed up.  Rap off the Raw Meat bolts on the opposite side of the boulder (note: They're really too far away to use as an anchor unless you use your rope to anchor the leader who then brings the second up from above)
content.protection: I used one #2, one #3, and two #4's
content.location: Route climbs the same crack as Raw Meat, but on the other side of the Hamburger boulder.  Bring your second up to clean it and rappel off the fixed anchor above Raw Meat

content.description: Nice fingercrack.  Short, but good.
content.protection: Use small gear to protect and to set anchors.  Anchor access 20 feet left of the route.
content.location: Northeast face of the Grade A Boulder, just around the corner from Top Choice.  Starts at the base of a tree.

content.description: Climb the arête on southwest side of the Matterhorn Boulder.  It is found just to the left of Golden Corral.
content.protection: Anchors set in the crack for Top Choice and appropriate runners for the route you need to do on the Matterhorn boulder
content.location: Southwest arête of Matterhorn Boulder

climbs.name: Golden Corral
climbs.fa: Jacob Valdez, Eddie Eisazedeh, Lin Ming

content.description: On the southwest corner of Grade A Boulder.  Climb the arete.  Use medium-sized pro to set up an anchor in the crack on top of the boulder.  The crack is several yards back from the edge.  Use long runners for top-rope.
content.protection: Anchors using medium sized pro placed in the crack several yards back from the edge.
content.location: Southwest Arete of the Grade A boulder

content.description: Fun slab boulder problem with both positive and slopey edges. This is the easiest climb on the boulder and can be used to set a top rope on the 2 bolt anchor for the harder climbs on the north side of the boulder.
content.protection: Crash pad.
content.location: Prominent black streak located on the south western side of the Flathead Boulder (the most northerly boulder of the Carnivores).

content.description: One of the hardest climbs at Enchanted Rock.  This a top rope route that climbs the straight line from the anchors for Top Choice and meets it at the top.  The start is from the base just to the left of the start of Top Choice.
content.protection: Anchors built using pro in the crack at the top of Top Choice
content.location: Carnivores of Enchanted Rock.  In the top choice alcove just to the left of Top Choice.

content.description: Climb the overhung corner on the North face of flathead boulder (the face furthest away from the loop trail or at the very back of the boulders) trending left as you go up.
content.protection: crash pads
content.location: The North face of the flathead boulder which is the furthest boulder away when you approach the Carnivore boulders.

content.description: Face climb to the right of the back side of the crack that forms Top Choice.  Very nice problem.
content.protection: Anchors with medium pro in crack
content.location: Opposite face of Top Choice on the Grade A boulder

content.description: After pulling the crux on Raw Meat set a high piece then head right onto the unprotected face. Go through both scooped out dishes for full value. The rock is mostly good moves not that bad. Don't fall....
content.protection: Set gear in Raw Meat,  first 2 cruxes reasonably projected. Don't fall on the finish!
content.location: Straight right from 1st rest on Raw Meat into dish, up then right again into second dish. Straight to the top.

content.description: The crack is found on the southwest side of the Cactus Boulder just left of the black streak.  The crack disappears before reaching the top.  Face climb the last 8 feet.
content.protection: Requires small gear, two top anchors.
content.location: The Cactus Boulder in the Carnivore Boulders of Enchanted Rock

content.description: Found on the southwest face of Grade A Boulder.  It is found to the right of Golden Corral.  Climb the black streak to the top.
content.protection: Anchors using medium sized pro to set up anchor in the crack on top of the boulder, which several yards from the edge.  Use long runners for toprope
content.location: Southwest face of the Grade A Boulder in the Carnivores.

content.description: Located on the backside of the Top Choice crack on the opposite face of the Grade A Boulder.  Wonderful small crack for smaller bodies and people new to climbing.
content.protection: Anchors in medium sized pro in the crack above the route.
content.location: Grade A Boulder.  Top Choice crack on the opposite side of Top Choice

content.description: A group of boulders clustered off the southwest slope of the Little Dome.  The short approach and density of steep, excellent crack climbing makes this a fairly popular area.  The Hamburger Boulder and the Grade A Boulder are the two largest rocks, both with excellent cracks.  They are surrounded by small boulders that yield excellent bouldering and some shorter topropes.  The cracks face various directions and shade is almost always an option.  Certainly one of the top crack climbing areas in the park.
